learning_objectives.objective: Define 'Training Hours per Team Member' as a capacity metric in incident response (total training hours delivered divided by number of team members) and recall key NIST SP 800-53 IR-2 requirements for training frequency and role-based content.

Explain the importance of tracking training hours per team member for maintaining IR team capacity, including how it supports skill development amid evolving threats and links to prior knowledge on IR roles from Subdomain 002_Incident Response Team Organization.
Calculate average training hours per team member for a given IR team (e.g., total 500 hours / 10 members = 50 hours/member) and apply industry benchmarks like 40-80 hours annually per role.
Analyze training hour distributions across IR roles (e.g., forensics specialists vs. basic responders) to identify gaps relative to NIST IR-2 role-based requirements.
Evaluate a sample IR training plan for compliance with NIST SP 800-53 IR-2, considering frequency, updates, and real-world constraints like budgets.
Design a 12-month training schedule for a 10-member IR team, incorporating quarterly tabletop exercises (8-16 hours) and role-specific benchmarks.
